Deforestation significantly reduces the provision of numerous ecosystem services such as carbon storage, water regulation, pollination, pest control, and nutrient cycling (Houghton et al., 1996). instruct_authoritative:
An Application Programming Interface (API) is a set of protocols, routines, and tools that allow different software applications to communicate with each other. APIs enable developers to build software components that can interact with one another, facilitating the exchange of data and functionality between different systems.

The primary function of an API is to provide a standardized way for software components to interact with each other. By using APIs, developers can create reusable code that can be integrated into various software projects, reducing development time and improving efficiency. APIs also enable third-party developers to access and use existing software components, promoting innovation and collaboration within the software industry.
